title: [Chinese Language][Music] Cuijian - Show Your Colour
description:
[Chinese Language][Music] Cuijian - Show Your Colour
----------------------------------------------------------------------

  brought to you by DaoBan

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Content:

Mainland China Rock n Roll

Cuijian is considered to be the "Father of Chinese Rock"

-You can find out the details of Why here: <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cui_Jian" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cui_Jian</a>
-You can see his website here: <a href=" http://www.cuijian.com/ENGLISH/Pages/main_interface.html" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.cuijian.com/ENGLISH/Pages/main_interface.html</a>


The Chinese title is:  "gei ni yi dian yan se".  The English title of the album as listed on the CD case is:  "Show Your Colour".  I would have translated it as "Giving you a little colour" or "Give You Some Colour", but then again, what do I know?


My opinion?  It&#039;s pretty decent rock-n-roll.  Much better than most of the stuff that is popular in mainland China.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes on the files:

-Nothing fancy:  CD -> Foobar -> 254kbps VBR -> MP3

-As usual, I didn&#039;t enter the Chinese language titles for the tracks, because:
--It would take me too long
--Chinese characers might not exist well on your computer
--If you like it enough, you can figure it out yourself :)


----------------------------------------------------------------------


Comments/Thanks:

Like anyone else, I appreciate comments, but they aren&#039;t really necessary.

The best way you can thank me is by pointing me to, or creating torrents of, 
	1.  Language
	2.  Philosophy
	3.  History
	4.  Good Jam Band Music (Live and Lossless for the win!!)
	5.  Other Helpful Stuff

Second best way you can thank me, is by downloading and seeding.

----------------------------------------------------------------------

And, of course...

Cuijian was a pretty key figure in bringing rock to China.  Give the guy props for that.  And, the music is pretty good too.  (IMHO)

So...

If you like it, buy it.
